html: As a kid I often wondered why today was called #GoodFriday. Now I know it's “good” when someone pays the price others owe, like when a big brother takes the punishment that his little sister deserved. Jesus paid the price for our sins and for that I will always be thankful.pic.twitter.com/E5XsHZxVqg

html: (1/2) I was saddened to learn of the news that President George H.W. Bush had passed. “Bush 41,” as he was affectionately known, served his country in WWII as a combat pilot, then as an envoy to China, U.S. Representative, CIA Director, VP, and finally President of the U.S.
text: (1/2) I was saddened to learn of the news that President George H.W. Bush had passed. “Bush 41,” as he was affectionately known, served his country in WWII as a combat pilot, then as an envoy to China, U.S. Representative, CIA Director, VP, and finally President of the U.S.

html: I'm pleased w/ new NAFTA agreement with Canada and Mexico. Particularly pleased that Canada is willing to open their dairy markets→ the 241% tariff imposed on our fluid milk compared to the 0% tariff the U.S. imposed on Canadian milk was an injustice that needed to be rectified.

html: I voted tonight on a $15B rescissions package, a bill that “de-obligates” unused funds from of a variety of programs. This is a fiscally responsible step forward in how we govern, and I look forward to more progress in addressing our burgeoning debt in the coming months.
text: I voted tonight on a $15B rescissions package, a bill that “de-obligates” unused funds from of a variety of programs. This is a fiscally responsible step forward in how we govern, and I look forward to more progress in addressing our burgeoning debt in the coming months.

html: I wrote a letter to the Navy two weeks ago with @RepHartzler and over 40 Members urging them to seriously consider the ramifications of a secular-humanist chaplain not only to the essence of the Chaplain Corps but to the brave men and women in uniform serving our country. (3/3)
text: I wrote a letter to the Navy two weeks ago with @RepHartzler and over 40 Members urging them to seriously consider the ramifications of a secular-humanist chaplain not only to the essence of the Chaplain Corps but to the brave men and women in uniform serving our country. (3/3)

html: It would open the door to a host of so-called chaplains who represent philosophical worldviews and NOT the distinctly religious role of the Chaplain Corps. I applaud the Navy for upholding the truth. (2/3)
text: It would open the door to a host of so-called chaplains who represent philosophical worldviews and NOT the distinctly religious role of the Chaplain Corps. I applaud the Navy for upholding the truth. (2/3)

html: I am relieved that the Navy has rejected the application of an atheist chaplain for their Chaplain Corps. Appointing an atheist to a historically religious role would've gone against everything the chaplaincy was created to do. (1/3)
text: I am relieved that the Navy has rejected the application of an atheist chaplain for their Chaplain Corps. Appointing an atheist to a historically religious role would've gone against everything the chaplaincy was created to do. (1/3)
